result.execSummary:
The defendant Anne M. Simon was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Alter Price (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Any other conditions per agent.   ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

records.addlTxt:
1:41 PM Prosecuting attorney Gabriel David Arevalo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anne M. Simon in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Anne M. Simon.  Atty. states going to be a plea with argued sentencing. Chapter 950 complied with. No requests for restitution. State requests - 30 days jail, $453.00 costs and DNA. Atty. Hayes requests - probation concurrent to other 14CF.   No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court.  Court finds Defendant guilty.  Court withhold sentence.

Count 1:
12 mos. probation, Concurrent
$453.00 Costs fees (PAID THRU SAUK CO. CLERK OF COURTS) 
30 Hours of Community Service
Any other conditions per agent
Paperwork handed in court.

1:20 PM Prosecuting attorney C. Remington McConnell and intern Dan Moon in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anne M. Simon not in court.  Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court for Anne M. Simon.  Stands Mute, Court enters Not Guilty Plea, set for trial.  Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Plea hearing on June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:05 PM Attorney Kathryn E Hayes in court.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Recv'd offer, still in talks to come to resolution. Requests plea hearing date in June.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on April 21, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
